result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph Samuel Thayer Jr.

records.addlTxt:
10:20 AM Defendant Joseph Samuel Thayer Jr. appeared by video.  Attorney Stephanie E Thomas-Schmidt in court for Joseph Samuel Thayer Jr.  Attorney Aaron B Marcoux appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and appearances. Waived reading. Not guilty plea is entered. Bond to continue.
Status conference scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 02:10 pm.
Status conference on November 21, 2022 at 02:10 pm.

1:01 PM Defendant Joseph Samuel Thayer Jr. appeared by video.  Attorney Stephanie E Thomas-Schmidt appeared by video for Joseph Samuel Thayer Jr.  Attorney Aaron B Marcoux in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and appearances. Atty Thomas-Schmidt speaks to the court re: non-appearance. Defendant has been in treatment.

Current address while in treatment-2113 12 1/2 St. Cameron, WI

State makes bond argument-requesting bond be reinstated. No objection from Atty Thomas-Schmidt. Court reinstates bond and it is to continue.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on October 3, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Voluntary appearance on September 1, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Defendant's Motion for ZOOM Voluntary Appearance

11:10 AM Defendant Joseph Samuel Thayer Jr. not in court.  Attorney Aaron B Marcoux in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Ryan Reid in court for Joseph Samuel Thayer Jr. Court calls case-State requests warrant. Granted.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
w/ a $2500.00 signature bond.

No contact w/ D.V.C dob: 08/08/1976
Absolute sobriety. Not to consume/possess any controlled substances unless prescribed.

1:00 PM Defendant Joseph S. Thayer appeared by video, in custody. Court calls case and appearances. ADA Ness appears for the State. Attorney Thomas-Schmidt appears for the Public Defenders office. Court finds probable cause. Defendant does qualify for public defender representation. Court questions the defendant.

Current address: Homeless-Staying at Dolittle Park in Birchwood in a tent.  Defendant does have a PO BOX 276 in Hayward, WI
Current phone #: 715-580-1577
Employed part-time @ Mary's Bluegill-No contacts to Washburn County

State makes bond argument-requesting $2500.00 signature bond w/ a $250.00 cash component. Atty Thomas-Schmidt makes argument-requesting a signature bond.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 10:00 am.
